Add Feed

Sample

×

What type of feed will you add?

  • ArduinoLalala I wanna add an arduino
  • Current Cost NetSmartLalala I'm a control freak
  • Twitter StatsLalala I like birds
  • Something ElseLalala I'm clueless or a pro

Needs

  • cosmui.modal.js
  • cosmui.toggler.js
  • cosmui.steps.js

Methods

Next step cosmUI.steps.next( current <section> [, next <section> ] )
Previous step cosmUI.steps.back( current <section> [, back <section> ] )
Revert to start screen cosmUI.steps.revert()
Re-assign events cosmUI.steps.reload()

The next() and back() methods can only be used when the user is in the accordion screen. The second argument is optional on both.

Tips

  • You can perform crazy stunts such as jumping from step 1 to step 3 and vice versa by using next() and back() with the second argument as whatever step you wish.
  • If you need to validate each step then remove data-step from the "next" button and use next() on your script to programatically jump to next step.

Featured Hardware

Featured Hardware

Arduino & Arduino Ethernet

Arduino is an open-source electronics prototyping platform based on flexible, easy-to-use hardware and software - with Cosm examples in the Arduino IDE it's the quickest and easiest way to get Cosm-connected! Find out more
